SelectionTitle: S000. Opening Slide for PPS – Sales – Blanket Order Processing
Title: S000. Opening Slide for PPS – Sales – Blanket Order Processing
Title_short: Opening Slide for PPS – Sales – Blanket Order Processing
Desc_Next1: About Palco Power Systems and Scott Electric and a Welcome to Training
Narr1_seed: Opening Slide for PPS – Sales – Blanket Order Processing
Narr2_seed: Opening Slide for PPS.
Narr3_seed:
Palco Power Systems is a specialized power solutions provider and an authorized KOHLER distributor, serving customers across western Pennsylvania, West Virginia, and western Maryland. Since 1972, Palco has supplied reliable generator systems and power equipment to industrial, commercial, municipal, healthcare, and residential customers who depend on uninterrupted power.
As part of the Scott Electric family since 1993, Palco Power Systems combines deep technical expertise with the broader resources of a leading independent electrical distributor. Our portfolio includes KOHLER industrial, mobile (towable), residential, and portable generator systems; pumps; other power systems and components; Honda portable units; transfer equipment; and related accessories, including ASCO and PSP components.
Over the years, Palco’s territory and responsibilities have grown along with its reputation:
• 1972 – Palco becomes an authorized KOHLER distributor in western Pennsylvania.
• 1984 – Territory expands to include West Virginia and western Maryland.
• 1989 – Area of responsibility further expands to include western New York State.
• 1993 – Scott Electric Company acquires Palco.
• 2001 – Territory is adjusted with the removal of western New York State.
Most recently, Palco Power Systems was the first Scott Electric division to host a Conference Room Pilot (CRP) for the new Infor CloudSuite software, demonstrating leadership and innovation in how we use technology to support customers and internal operations.
Narr1: Slide S000. Opening Slide for PPS – Sales – Blanket Order Processing — Opening Slide for PPS – Sales – Blanket Order Processing.
Narr2: Opening Slide for PPS.
Narr3:

Our portfolio includes KOHLER industrial, mobile (towable), residential, and portable generator systems; pumps; other power systems and components; Honda portable units; transfer equipment; and related accessories, including ASCO and PSP components.
Over the years, Palco’s territory and responsibilities have grown along with its reputation:
• 1972 – Palco becomes an authorized KOHLER distributor in western Pennsylvania.
• 1984 – Territory expands to include West Virginia and western Maryland.
• 1989 – Area of responsibility further expands to include western New York State.
• 1993 – Scott Electric Company acquires Palco.
• 2001 – Territory is adjusted with the removal of western New York State.
Most recently, Palco Power Systems was the first Scott Electric division to host a Conference Room Pilot (CRP) for the new Infor CloudSuite software, demonstrating leadership and innovation in how we use technology to support customers and internal operations.

Narr3_seed:
Palco Power Systems is a specialized power solutions provider and an authorized KOHLER distributor, serving customers across western Pennsylvania, West Virginia, and western Maryland. Since 1972, Palco has supplied reliable generator systems and power equipment to industrial, commercial, municipal, healthcare, and residential customers who depend on uninterrupted power.
As part of the Scott Electric family since 1993, Palco Power Systems combines deep technical expertise with the broader resources of a leading independent electrical distributor. Our portfolio includes KOHLER industrial, mobile (towable), residential, and portable generator systems; pumps; other power systems and components; Honda portable units; transfer equipment; and related accessories, including ASCO and PSP components.
Over the years, Palco’s territory and responsibilities have grown along with its reputation:• 1972 – Palco becomes an authorized KOHLER distributor in western Pennsylvania.• 1984 – Territory expands to include West Virginia and western Maryland.• 1989 – Area of responsibility further expands to include western New York State.• 1993 – Scott Electric Company acquires Palco.• 2001 – Territory is adjusted with the removal of western New York State.
Most recently, Palco Power Systems was the first Scott Electric division to host a Conference Room Pilot (CRP) for the new Infor CloudSuite software, demonstrating leadership and innovation in how we use technology to support customers and internal operations. This work reflects the dedication of the Palco team—including Tanner Schwartz, Valerie Markish, Tim Drop, Jen Schlegel, and Subi Rajagopalan—along with support from the broader ERP project, Champions, and Executive Sponsors. The management teams at Palco Power Systems and Scott Electric continue to support these efforts by prioritizing training, process improvement, and the successful adoption of the new system.

Welcome to the Palco Power Systems Training Site.
This section of the Scott Electric Training Site is designed to help you build the knowledge and skills needed to support our power systems customers safely, accurately, and efficiently—whether you work in sales, service, parts, rentals, administration, or support. Here you will find guided learning, reference materials, and role-based courses tailored to the work we do every day at Palco: sizing and selecting generators, supporting projects, coordinating installations, servicing equipment, and taking care of customers before, during, and after the sale.

Thank you for investing your time in training. Your commitment to learning and continuous improvement helps keep Palco Power Systems—and Scott Electric as a whole—reliable, responsive, and growing as we continue our customer-focused operations.

SelectionTitle: S2. Create a Blanket Order using OPM - PPS Sales
Title: S2. Create a Blanket Order using OPM - PPS Sales
Title_short: Create a Blanket Order using OPM - PPS Sales
Desc_Next1: Decision is the Generator a “Modified Build” ? - PPS Sales
Narr1_seed: Create a Blanket Order using OPM - PPS Sales
Narr2_seed: Create a Blanket Order using OPM - PPS Sales
Narr3_seed:
the process starts with the creation of Blanket Order A blanket order (BL) represents a contract to supply a quantity of goods to be shipped on different dates, and possibly to different locations, over a specified period of time. BLs are automatically converted to blanket releases (BR) when it comes time to ship the products. Use these instructions to create a BL.

Select Sales > Entry > Order.
Select Blanket Order in the Order Type field.
Specify the required information on the page, and then click Next.
To use lump sum billing:
Select the Lump Sum Bill option and specify an amount.
Select the Print Line Price option to print prices on invoices.
Click Submit.
If lump sum billing does not apply to the order, click Submit without specifying any information.
Narr1: Slide S2. Create a Blanket Order using OPM - PPS Sales — Create a Blanket Order using OPM - PPS Sales.
Narr2: Create a Blanket Order using OPM - PPS Sales
Narr3:
the process starts with the creation of Blanket Order A blanket order (BL) represents a contract to supply a quantity of goods to be shipped on different dates, and possibly to different locations, over a specified period of time. BLs are automatically converted to blanket releases (BR) when it comes time to ship the products. Use these instructions to create a BL.

Select Sales > Entry > Order.
Select Blanket Order in the Order Type field.
Specify the required information on the page, and then click Next.
To use lump sum billing:
Select the Lump Sum Bill option and specify an amount.
Select the Print Line Price option to print prices on invoices.
Click Submit.
If lump sum billing does not apply to the order, click Submit without specifying any information.

Narr3_seed:
As the there are three releases one the generator , two the ats and three the startup service 3 releases need to be added to the blanket orderA blanket release (BR) is a portion of the original blanket order (BL). Each blanket release retains the original BL number, but is assigned a different suffix. You can specify different ship dates and ship to locations for each blanket release.

Select Sales > Entry > Blanket Release.
Specify the blanket order number, and then click Search.
Click New.
Specify information for this blanket release.
The promise date and requested ship date are required.
Click Continue.
Review the information and make changes if required.
Click Save.
Related topics

SelectionTitle: S10. Print Pick ticket on “01 “ Suffix – OPM - PPS Sales
Title: S10. Print Pick ticket on “01 “ Suffix – OPM - PPS Sales
Title_short: Print Pick ticket on “01 “ Suffix – OPM - PPS Sales
Desc_Next1: Do Shipping feedback for the picked items – OPM - PPS Sales
Narr1_seed: Print Pick ticket on “01 “ Suffix – OPM - PPS Sales
Narr2_seed: Print Pick ticket on “01 “ Suffix – OPM - PPS Sales
Narr3_seed:
A pick ticket is printed Sales > Entry > OEE Reports > OEEPP

Function acronym: OEEPP

Use this report to print pick tickets so that the products can be picked from the warehouse and staged for shipping. Optionally, you can print Integrated Barcode pick labels or cartonization package labels. Run this report after a sales order is created, and you have optionally sent an acknowledgment to the customer.

You can print pick tickets automatically from Sales Order Entry and Sales Entry Shipping Feedback Report through this function. You can also print pick tickets with Sales Entry Back Order Fill Report after an order is filled.

A temporary lock is placed on orders until picking is complete. Because pick tickets can be printed from multiple functions, the lock ensures that the pick tickets are printed only once. If the Sales Entry Back Order Fill Report or Sales Entry Pick Tickets Report does not finish processing, the user that created the order can unlock the order in Sales Order Entry.

You can print pick tickets automatically from Sales Order Entry and Sales Entry Shipping Feedback Report through this function. You can also print pick tickets with Sales Entry Back Order Fill Report after an order is filled.

A temporary lock is placed on orders until picking is complete. Because pick tickets can be printed from multiple functions, the lock ensures that the pick tickets are printed only once. If the Sales Entry Back Order Fill Report or Sales Entry Pick Tickets Report does not finish processing, the user that created the order can unlock the order in Sales Order Entry.

SelectionTitle: S12. Goes through the AR billing Process – OPM - PPS Sales
Title: S12. Goes through the AR billing Process – OPM - PPS Sales
Title_short: Goes through the AR billing Process – OPM - PPS Sales
Desc_Next1: Decision, Were (3) Three Releases created for this Order ? - Single step - PPS Sales
Narr1_seed: Goes through the AR billing Process – OPM - PPS Sales
Narr2_seed: Goes through the AR billing Process – OPM - PPS Sales
Narr3_seed:
nvoice processing
Invoicing is one of the last required steps to complete an order. Invoice processing places the order in Stage 4 (Invoiced) or Stage 5 (Paid), if the payment amount equals the invoice amount. An order cannot be changed or deleted after it is invoice processed, although an invoiced order can be copied to a new order.

For range or list processing, orders are invoiced, the order stage changed, and all Customer, General Ledger and Product updates are performed in this order:

RM orders in order number order
All other orders in order number order
This processing order is separate from the print order.

If the Our Records Only Invoice option is selected in Sales Order Entry, the order is invoice processed but output is not generated.
Narr1: Slide S12. Goes through the AR billing Process – OPM - PPS Sales — Goes through the AR billing Process – OPM - PPS Sales.
Narr2: Goes through the AR billing Process – OPM - PPS Sales
Narr3:
nvoice processing

An order cannot be changed or deleted after it is invoice processed, although an invoiced order can be copied to a new order.

For range or list processing, orders are invoiced, the order stage changed, and all Customer, General Ledger and Product updates are performed in this order:

RM orders in order number order
All other orders in order number order
This processing order is separate from the print order.

If the Our Records Only Invoice option is selected in Sales Order Entry, the order is invoice processed but output is not generated.
